citation.article-title: Paenibacillus pueri sp. nov., isolated from Pu'er tea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus pueri sp. nov.
Paenibacillus pueri (pu′e.ri. N.L. n. puerum Pu'er, a tea from China; N.L. gen. n. pueri of Pu'er).
Cells are Gram-positive, catalase-positive, oxidase-positive, motile, and have a subterminal ellipsoidal spore in swollen sporangia.
Colonies grown on TSB agar are round, smooth, cream-white and approximately 3–5 mm in diameter after 1 week growth.
Single cells are slightly curved rods, measuring 2.5–3.5×0.5–0.8 μm.
Growth occurs at temperatures of 25–42 °C in TSB medium, with optimum growth occurring at 37 °C.
Grows in the presence of 0–6 % (w/v) NaCl and at pH 5.5–10.4.
Does not grow in media containing ≥7 % (w/v) NaCl.
Grows well on the surface of TSB agar when incubated under aerobic or anaerobic conditions.
Gelatin, Tween 80 and starch are hydrolysed, but casein, cellulose and xylan are not.

Positive reactions are obtained for acetoin production, citrate utilization, β-galactosidase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and nitrate reduction, but negative reactions for arginine dihydrolase, phenylalanine deaminase, urease, tryptophan deaminase, H2S production and indole production.

Produces acid from arbutin, l-arabinose, aesculin, fructose, galactose, gentiobiose, glucose, glycerol, inositol, 5-ketogluconate, mannose, maltose, mannitol, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, ribose, salicin, sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, turanose and d-xylose, but not from adonitol, amygdalin, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, erythritol, d-arabinose, dulcitol, d-fucose, glycogen, inulin, lactose, d-lyxose, methyl α-d-mannose, methyl α-d-glucose, methyl β-d-xylose, rhamnose, sorbose, starch, d-tagatose, xylitol or l-xylose.
Cells contain MK-7 as the predominant isoprenoid quinone, and do not contain diaminopimelic acid in the cell-wall peptidoglycan.
Cells cultured in TSB medium contain anteiso-C15 : 0 as the predominant cellular fatty acid.
Major polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylmonomethylethanolamine, phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylglycerol.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 56.6 mol%.
The type strain, b09i-3T (=KCTC 13223T= CECT 7360T), was isolated from Pu'er tea. b13i-1 is a second strain of the species.
